an5.127:4.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant with five qualities is not fit to live apart from a Saṅgha community.
an5.127:4.3: It’s when a mendicant is not content with any kind of robe, alms-food, lodging, and medicinal requisites and supports for the sick. And they have a lot of sensual thoughts.
an5.127:4.4: A mendicant with these five qualities is not fit to live apart from a Saṅgha community.
an5.127:5.1: A mendicant with five qualities is fit to live apart from a Saṅgha community.
an5.127:5.3: It’s when a mendicant is content with any kind of robe, alms-food, lodging, and medicinal requisites and supports for the sick. And they think a lot about renunciation.
an5.127:5.4: A mendicant with these five qualities is fit to live apart from a Saṅgha community.”
